intro: Parosela berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican parosela, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often opposite in arrangement. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
